name: Avoid using memory management Functions (free/malloc/realloc)
Avoid using signals management Functions
DEPRECATED: Use of style sheets (JEE)

Ensure that the use of "forEach" is well controlled
Ensure to use an alternative to Document.all collection
Avoid declaring VB Variables without typing them (.NET)
Ensure you have released your SQL connection after an effective lifetime
Avoid using String.Empty for empty string tests
Ensure that the boolean are not instantiated
Ensure  let the system decide when it needs to collect the heap, and whether or not to do a full collection
Prefer using List and Map implementations instead of using Vector.
Prefer using HashMap instead of HashTable
Ensure to use class invocation or method call instead of dynamic instantiation known to be slower
Ensure that EJB Entities are accessed through their local  Interface instead of their remote interface.
Ensure that EJB Session are accessed through their local remote Interface instead of their remote Interface

Ensure to use StringBuilder or StringBuffer and StringBuilder.append() or StringBuffer.append() method instead
Avoid String concatenation in loops (.NET)
Ensure to create a StringBuilder or StringBuffer before entering the loop
Avoid method invocation in a loop termination expression
Ensure to have polymorphism over 'is' operator and downcasting
Ensure to not do object initialization inside a loop since it reduces performance
Ensure you don't instantiate objects in loops
Ensure to initialize the String with the literal.
Ensure to add a try finally bloc
Ensure to make static all methods not using instance members
Enforce noninstantiability with a private constructor
DataReader must be called using CommandBehavior.CloseConnection enumeration
Call 'base.Dispose()' or 'MyBase.Finalize()' in the "finally" block of 'Dispose(bool)' methods
Dispose() methods should call GC.SuppressFinalize
Methods that do not use instance fields\methods should be static (.NET)
Ensure adding a private default constructor then the class can't be instantiated.
Avoid "SELECT *" queries
Avoid redundant indexes
Avoid too many Indexes on one Table

Avoid call to AcceptChanges in a loop

Prefer UNION ALL to UNION
Ensure to implement serialization if your web container implements such mechanisms or ignore it in others cases
Avoid changing DataSource member before ValueMember/DisplayMember
Disable constraints before merging DataSet
DEPRECATED: Avoid doing select on Datatable in loop
Avoid Repainting When Updating a ListBox
Ensure to use a lazy fetching strategy when the table contains lot of rows
Ensure to use the attribute select-before-update for the persistent class associated to a table that have the UPDATE trigger in order to not have UPDATE trigger when not necessary
Ensure to use table-per-subclass strategy when subclasses have many properties
Ensure to have the same collection between the getter and the setter
Choose table-per-class-hierarchy when the maximum added attributes of subclasses don't exceed 3
Ensure to use  lists, maps, bags, idbags and sets depending on your case to map a collection instead of using array to Map Collection
Ensure that static Field of type collection are not used
Ensure setting 'select-before-update' to true only for Hibernate Entity associated to table that fires an UPDATE trigger.

Prefer using SAX parser for large or medium sized XML file parsing instead of DOM parser
Prefer using Hibernate-provided implementations from third parties for connection pool to increase database access performances.
Ensure reducing the number of EJB beans to hold performance and complexity of the application
Ensure that no thread creation is done for application running on application server to avoid any performance and robustness issues.

Avoid Artifacts with SQL statement including subqueries

Ensure to write SQL query with a limited number of tables used in the FROM clause
Avoid usage of 'std::find_first_of'
Avoid defining Functions with 'struct' or 'class' parameters passed by value
Ensure that finalize() is not used as the time of execution is not garanteed
Ensure defining a business method for removing the Stateful bean instance and call it from the client side
Ensure not having indirect String concatenation inside loops to avoid making your software performance slowly.
Ensure not having direct or indirect remote calls inside a loop to avoid making your software performance slow
Provide a private default Constructor for utility Classes or use free Functions in a Namespace
Invoke 'delete' with the same form as the matching 'new'
Do not return a dereferenced pointer allocated inside the function
Avoid using 'new[]', prefer 'std::vector' or 'std::array'
Ensure setting timeouts for blocking synchronous calls to prevent an infinite waiting time
Ensure you have released your SQL connection after an effective lifetime
Ensure you have released your stream connection after an effective lifetime
Ensure using dedicated stored procedures when multiple data accesses are needed
Avoid artifacts having Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
Avoid using GC.Collect()
Avoid thread creation for application running on application server
Ensure not using expired or released database resource to prevent access to sensitive data that is associated with a different user or entity.
Avoid using querySelectorAll, prefer getElementsByTagName() or getElementsByClassName() to have better performance.
Make sure you do not execute a function inside loop termination to avoid performance issues, use a variable to store the value of a function instead
Replace for-in loop with a regular for loop with index to avoid slower performance
Replace forEach() with a regular loop to ensure better performance
Ensure that the web-service calls made from the client are not inside a loop so that efficiency is not impacted due to communications overhead
Ensure having a process queue that will manage all the requests with a limited number of concurrents when making calls to web services
Ensure to use intermediate variables for minimizing dot notations for references within a loop so that performance is not adversely impacted
Use asynchronous loading of Javascript files or code to avoid a single point of failure in page loading
Ensure to assign a reference variable to a function output if it has to be used inside a loop to make performance better
Ensure using document.getElementById() instead of documetn.all to avoid slow loading of DOM elements
Move JavaScript functions from HTML file to a '.js' file
Prefer using a computed property as a condition, if needed, instead of using v-for and v-if on the same element
Ensure to clear event listeners after components are destroyed to prevent memory leaks
Ensure that you are not making API/web service calls inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Ensure you minize the number of web service ajax calls inside a loop
Ensure you don't use the element type in your selector when using class selectors in jQuery.
Ensure using find for Id->Child nested selectors for better performance
Always cache your jQuery selector, based on class, returned objects in variables for reuse.
Prefer using "type=" notation instead of ":".
Ensure you don't manipulate stylesheet with css() method to avoid performance issue
Ensure you don't universal selectors to avoid performance issue.
Prefer using angular.forEach() instead of JS implementation [].forEach for an AngularJS app to enhance performace
Ensure that you are not making API/web service calls inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Ensure that you are not using a web service inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Ensure your web application interactivity by using 'track by' option in 'ng-repeat' block
The variables "__dirname" and "__filename" should not be used in string concatenation to avoid having an invalid path
Ensure having only one routing handler per path to avoid an efficiency issue
“http.get” or “http.request” should not be used inside a loop to optimize the number of calls between the client application and web service server
Ensure you minize the number of api call especially inside a loop
Ensure you don't have multiple artifacts updating data on the same NoSQL table (Javascript)
Ensure you don't have multiple artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL table (Javascript)
Ensure you don't have multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL table (Javascript)
Always ensure not using the concatenation of the strings in a loop as  a costly operation.
Ensure you have provided a debounceTime after calling an Observable with using Rx.observable.fromEvent
Ensure you have added "track by" syntax into your ngFor block
Ensure you have closed  Node.js filesystem after using open or openSync.
The variables "__dirname" and "__filename" should not be used in string concatenation to avoid having an invalid path
Ensure having only one routing handler per path to avoid an efficiency issue
Use Any instead of Count to check for a non-empty sequence
Avoid client provided dictionaries to have high request sizes
Ensure that dynamically allocated memory on local pointer in functions/methods is freed.
Ensure to declare arrays with a defined size
Esnure that the exceptions are thrown by value
Ensure that pointer types are not cast to integral types
Prefer using a Join with a consition when making SQL queries so that performance is not adversely impacted due to cartesian/cross join
Prefer using a Join with a consition when making SQL queries on XXL tables so that performance is not adversely impacted due to cartesian/cross join
Ensure to include index in your SQL table so that performance of your app is not adversely impacted
Ensure to include index in your SQL XXL tables so that performance of your app is not adversely impacted
Make sure you use SARGable predicate in WHERE clauses and JOINS to prevent additional costs on CPU
Prefer using INNER JOINS instead of NATURAL JOINS for better performance
Try to separate JOIN and WHERE clauses by following ANSI-Standard joins format to improve maintainability and readabitliy
Prefer not using GROUP BY clauses in queries as it hampers the performance and is inefficient
To ensure query performance make sure you do not use Dynamic SQL, specially for modules that are called too often
Always use MINUS or EXCEPT operator instead of NOT EXISTS and NOT IN subqueries for better execution performance
Ensure that you are not making queries and Joins on too many tables or views as it hampers execution performance
When using EXISTS or NOT EXISTS clauses make sure that you refer to parent object and not  independent clauses to ensure better performance
Prefer replacing DISTINCT in your queries with a WHERE, FROM clause that fetches only the required data
To improve the readability of your SQL statements use IN test condition instead of multiple OR conditions on same identifier
Prefer to use a similar syntax for JOIN in same SQL queries and not mix ANSI and non-ANSI syntax
When using LIKE operator make sure the first character in search string is not a wildcard character as it reduces execution performance
Ensure that when using triangular joins you restrict the results with some extra conditions to avoid severe performance issues
Make sure you don't have synonyms with both private and public definitions to avoid complexity, try renaming one of them instead
Always use 'IS NULL' or 'IS NOT NULL' to check for Nullability instead of using '=' or '!=' operators
Ensure that when creating synonyms you define them as PRIVATE and not PUBLIC
Ensure that when chaining synonyms you do not loop them leading to synonym referring to itself as it will cause a error during execution
Ensure using a set-oriented approach instead of using a iterative approach caused by using cursors inside loops for better performance of queries
Ensure to use VARCHAR2 or NVARCHAR2 instead of CHAR, VARCHAR or NCHAR as the latter will be deprecated and uses more disk space
Ensure that you use CLOB, NCLOB or BLOB datatypes in tables instead of LONG or LONG RAW as the latter are deprecated
Each table should have a clustered index
Avoid Artifacts with a Complex SELECT Clause (SQL)
LIKE conditions should not be used without wildcards characters
XXL Tables should have a primary key / unique key constraint / unique index
Tables should have a primary key / unique key constraint / unique index
Ensure to not use explain() method in production code so that performance is not reduced
